content:
Diagnosis:
Right middle lobe adenosquamous carcinoma of lung, Stage IV with malignant pleural effusion

Staging investigations:
CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis 12 April 2024 - 4.2cm right middle lobe mass with right-sided pleural effusion
PET-CT 15 April 2024 - FDG-avid primary lesion, no distant metastases
MRI brain 16 April 2024 - No evidence of intracranial metastases

Pathology:
CT-guided biopsy confirms adenosquamous carcinoma
PD-L1 15%
EGFR/ALK/ROS1 negative

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
Osteoarthritis right knee

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Amlodipine 5mg OD
Paracetamol PRN

Allergies:
Penicillin - rash

Social history:
Lives with wife
Ex-smoker 40 pack years, stopped 2020
Retired accountant

Current situation:
Performance status 1
Breathless on moderate exertion
Right-sided chest pain requiring regular analgesia
Weight stable

Examination:
Reduced air entry right base
No clubbing
No lymphadenopathy

Plan:
1. For palliative chemotherapy with Carboplatin/Pemetrexed
2. Pleural aspiration to be arranged
3. Review in 2 weeks with blood results
4. CT scan after 3 cycles to assess response

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: PD-L1 15%, EGFR negative, ALK negative, ROS1 negative

cancer_timeline.value: CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis shows 4.2cm right middle lobe mass with right-sided pleural effusion
PET-CT shows FDG-avid primary lesion, no distant metastases
MRI brain shows no evidence of intracranial metastases
CT-guided biopsy confirms adenosquamous carcinoma, PD-L1 15%, EGFR/ALK/ROS1 negative

patient_facts.value: Right-sided chest pain requiring regular analgesia

status_updates.value: Stage IV right middle lobe lung adenosquamous carcinoma with malignant pleural effusion. Initial assessment for palliative chemotherapy.
Plan to commence palliative chemotherapy with Carboplatin/Pemetrexed
Pleural aspiration to be arranged and CT scan after 3 cycles to assess response
Review in 2 weeks with blood results
